inkface.canvas – Canvas¶

module:: inkface.canvas.canvas – Generic Canvas Backend¶

synopsis:This module contains Class definitions used for Generic Canvas Backend

Module Contents¶

class inkface.canvas.Face(svgname, autoload=True)¶
This is the base class from which backend specific Face classes should inherit.
svg¶

A reference to the SVG doc inkface.altsvg.VectorDoc from which this face is loaded

clone(curNodeName, newNodeName, new_x=-1, new_y=-1)¶

Clones an existing element of the face to create duplicate one. This method should be called by backend specific sub-class

Parameters:
  • curNodeName – name of existing element to be cloned
  • newNodeName – name the new element should have
  • new_x – [optional] x coord of new element
  • new_y – [optional] y coord of new element
get(key)¶

Access the elements by name This method has same result as accessing the element as Face’s attribute.

Parameter:key – Name of element you are looking for.
class inkface.canvas.Canvas¶

This is the base class from which backend specific Canvas classes should inherit.

add(face)¶

Adds the elements of the face to the internal elementQ.

Parameter:face – Face whose elements are to be added.
recalculate_clouds()¶
Recalculate the clouds for all elements in the elementQ.
remove(face)¶

Removes the elements of the face from internal elementQ.

Parameter:face – Face whose elements are to be removed.
class inkface.canvas.CanvasElement(svgelem)¶
This is the base class from which backend specific CanvasElement classes should inherit.
svg¶

A reference to inkface.altsvg.element.Element object

clouded((x, y))¶
Return type:True if this element is clouded by other elements at these coordinates. False otherwise. Typically useful to event processing logic of a backend specific subclass.
dup(newName)¶
This is a virtual method, to be implemented by backend specific subclass.
get_position()¶
Return type:A tuple giving (x,y) coordinates.
occupies((x, y))¶
Return type:True if this element occupies given coordinates (x, y), False otherwise. Typically useful to event processing logic of a backend specific subclass.
set_position((x, y))¶
Parameter:(x,y) – x,y coordinates to set this element’s position to
